result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshay S Crisler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Domestic abuse counseling required; rest of programming at discretion of agent; 1 set of costs; 6 days credit in the event of revocation. DNA sample to be provided at Richland County Sheriff's Department before Defendant is released to probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: (civil judgment previously entered for costs)

Defendant Deshay S Crisler in court, in custody. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court is reluctant to accept the parties' recommendation in this matter. Discussion between Court, counsel, and Def. Court rules: 90 days jail, concurrent with sentence now serving; count 2, 9 months jail concurrent with sentence now serving. Credit: 97 days. Costs have already been converted to civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 3, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Deshay S Crisler. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Reset requested. Def not here; was not produced.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for August 3, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Deshay S Crisler in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. ADA Amy Forehand in court for the State. Atty. M states the parties have an agreement for resolution; asks for time-served sentence. Court informs the parties that he is inclined not to accept this proposed disposition as the Court believes it is too light for the severity of the offense. Def is presently on ext. supervision for armed robbery (Milwaukee County case). Atty. M argues Defense' position - states def is not from this area and will be headed back to Milwaukee County; parties are concerned def won't receive rehabilitation he needs in the Milwaukee probation system. Court feels probation is better than the time served jail sentence. Court conducts colloquy with def. Def pleads guilty to both counts. Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty. Atty. M addresses the Court; asks for 6 days credit and 1 set of costs. Court withholds probation and orders 2 years probation. Conditions: domestic abuse counseling required; rest of programming to discretion of agent; 1 set of costs; 6 days credit in the event of revocation. DNA sample to be provided at RCSD.

Defendant Deshay S Crisler in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Matter on the calendar for initial appearance. Attorneys advise the Court that the parties wish to proceed to resolution. Minutes of the resolution proceedings taken to the "Plea/sentencing" event.
Initial appearance on April 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Deshay S Crisler. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Deshay S Crisler appeared by phone means from the RC Jail, in custody. Atty Harper asks for the matter to be setover for a plea and sentencing. Court setovers for an intital appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.
RCSD dispo of warrant
Arrest warrant amount $500 verified by ADA Amy Forehand

Arrest-Bench Warrant 
The person may be released upon payment of $500.00, plus statutory sheriffs fees. A new court date shall be provided to the defendant.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Deshay S Crisler. Def. does not appear.  Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Forehand asks for WA.  Court issues WA.
Status conference on February 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.

3:10 p.m.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Deshay S Crisler. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M not sure where def is though she has been in regular contact with him; had expected him to appear today. Matter was set for 2:30 p.m.  ADA asks for warrant.  Court notes def hasn't made an appearance since the bond hrg; Atty. M has always appeared for him.  Matter adj. to 2/23 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on February 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal appears for defendant. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty McD states ADA Forehand had made an offer.  STC set, could be a plea. NG plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
